issue.title: Missing requirement on InputIterator template parameter for priority_queue constructors

discussion.p: There is nothing in or more generally saying that InputIterator in the following constructor templates has to be an input iterator.
The second constructor template above therefore accepts
to produce a priority_queue that contains a single element 2. This behavior seems extremely questionable.

Set status to Tentatively Ready after discussion and poll.

discussion.note: 2021-06-07 Approved at June 2021 virtual plenary. Status changed: Voting → WP.

blockquote.p: [Drafting note: Because an upcoming paper provides iterator-pair constructors for other container adaptors, the wording below adds the restriction to so that it also covers the constructors that will be added by that paper. — end drafting note]

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4878.

li.p: Add the following paragraph to after p3:

p.ins: -?- A constructor template of a container adaptor shall not participate in overload resolution if it has an InputIterator template parameter and a type that does not qualify as an input iterator is deduced for that parameter.

blockquote.p: -4- A deduction guide for a container adaptor shall not participate in overload resolution if any of the following are true:

li.p: (4.1) — It has an InputIterator template parameter and a type that does not qualify as an input iterator is deduced for that parameter.
